commit.message:
configure.in: ldopen is never in -lexc, so don't test for it.

	* configure.in: ldopen is never in -lexc, so don't test for it.
	Add test for exc_resume in -lexc for Ada.
	* configure: Regenerated.

From-SVN: r42037

files.patch:
@@ -1,3 +1,9 @@
+Sun May 13 07:26:34 2001  Richard Kenner  <kenner@vlsi1.ultra.nyu.edu>
+
+	* configure.in: ldopen is never in -lexc, so don't test for it.
+	Add test for exc_resume in -lexc for Ada.
+	* configure: Regenerated.
+
 2001-05-12  Richard Henderson  <rth@redhat.com>
 
 	* dwarf2asm.c (size_of_encoded_value): New function.

@@ -3032,7 +3032,7 @@ if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'gcc_cv_collect2_libs'+set}'`\" = set"; then
   echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
 else
   save_LIBS="$LIBS"
-for libs in '' -lld -lmld '-lmld -lexc' \
+for libs in '' -lld -lmld \
 		'-L/usr/lib/cmplrs/cc2.11 -lmld' \
 		'-L/usr/lib/cmplrs/cc3.11 -lmld'
 do
@@ -3069,17 +3069,87 @@ case $gcc_cv_collect2_libs in
 esac
 
 
+# When building Ada code on Alpha, we need exc_resume which is usually in
+# -lexc.  So test for it.
+save_LIBS="$LIBS"
+LIBS=
+
+echo $ac_n "checking for library containing exc_resume""... $ac_c" 1>&6
+echo "configure:3079: checking for library containing exc_resume" >&5
+if eval "test \"`echo '$''{'ac_cv_search_exc_resume'+set}'`\" = set"; then
+  echo $ac_n "(cached) $ac_c" 1>&6
+else
+  ac_func_search_save_LIBS="$LIBS"
+ac_cv_search_exc_resume="no"
+cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
+#line 3086 "configure"
+#include "confdefs.h"
+/* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
+/* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
+    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
+char exc_resume();
+
+int main() {
+exc_resume()
+; return 0; }
+EOF
+if { (eval echo configure:3097: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+  rm -rf conftest*
+  ac_cv_search_exc_resume="none required"
+else
+  echo "configure: failed program was:" >&5
+  cat conftest.$ac_ext >&5
+fi
+rm -f conftest*
+test "$ac_cv_search_exc_resume" = "no" && for i in exc; do
+LIBS="-l$i  $ac_func_search_save_LIBS"
+cat > conftest.$ac_ext <<EOF
+#line 3108 "configure"
+#include "confdefs.h"
+/* Override any gcc2 internal prototype to avoid an error.  */
+/* We use char because int might match the return type of a gcc2
+    builtin and then its argument prototype would still apply.  */
+char exc_resume();
+
+int main() {
+exc_resume()
+; return 0; }
+EOF
+if { (eval echo configure:3119: \"$ac_link\") 1>&5; (eval $ac_link) 2>&5; } && test -s conftest${ac_exeext}; then
+  rm -rf conftest*
+  ac_cv_search_exc_resume="-l$i"
+break
+else
+  echo "configure: failed program was:" >&5
+  cat conftest.$ac_ext >&5
+fi
+rm -f conftest*
+done
+LIBS="$ac_func_search_save_LIBS"
+fi
+
+echo "$ac_t""$ac_cv_search_exc_resume" 1>&6
+if test "$ac_cv_search_exc_resume" != "no"; then
+  test "$ac_cv_search_exc_resume" = "none required" || LIBS="$ac_cv_search_exc_resume $LIBS"
+  
+else :
+  
+fi
+GNAT_LIBEXC="$LIBS"
+LIBS="$save_LIBS"
+
+
